Package com.redis.ds.ds_redis.json

Class RedisJson

java.lang.Object
com.redis.ds.ds_redis.json.RedisJson
public class RedisJson extends Object
The RedisJson class is responsible for accessing the RedisGraph module commands via the Jedis programmatic library. It designed to simplify the use of core Foundation class objects like items, documents and grids. You can instantiate this class from the parent RedisDS class. Note: This RedisJSON DS class assumes that it will be coupled with RediSearch DS class for data grid management. In this scenario, each data document will be stored as a key/value (JSON document) in the database and RediSearch will be used to locate them.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

    • setDataSchema

      public void setDataSchema(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc)
      Assigns the data document instance as the schema definition. The data schema definition is tracked in this package as a convenience to the calling application and used when the parent application needs to add, update or delete documents in the search index.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance

    • getDataSchema

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc getDataSchema()
      Retrieves the internal data schema data document definition.
      Returns:
      Data schema data document definition

    • isFeatureStandard

      public boolean isFeatureStandard(String aName)
      Identifies if the feature name is standard to the search data source package.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the feature
      Returns:
      true or false

    • createSchemaDoc

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc createSchemaDoc(String aName)
      Creates a data document with items suitable for a schema editor UI.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the schema
      Returns:
      Data document representing a schema

    • schemaDocToDataGrid

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid schemaDocToDataGrid(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc, boolean anIsExtended)
      Convert a data document schema definition into a data grid suitable for rendering in a schema editor UI.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance (representing the schema)
      anIsExtended - If true, then non standard features will be recognized
      Returns:
      Data grid representing the schema definition

    • dataGridToSchemaDoc

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc dataGridToSchemaDoc(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid)
      Collapses a data grid representing a schema definition back into a data document schema. This method assumes that you invoked the schemaDocToDataGrid() method to build the data grid originally.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      Returns:
      Data document schema definition

    • keyPrefixFromSchema

      public String keyPrefixFromSchema() throws RedisDSException
      Returns the key prefix string associated with the schema.
      Returns:
      Hash prefix string
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • getSchemaKeyName

      public String getSchemaKeyName()
      Generates and returns a unique key name for the JSON schema that can be used to store/retrieve the definition in Redis.
      Returns:
      Search schema key name

    • updateSchema

      public boolean updateSchema(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid, com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data items captured in the DataDoc against the schema. The data items must be derived from the schema definition. Note: The data document must designate a data item as a primary key and that value must be assigned prior to using this method.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance
      Returns:
      true if schema needed to be updated and false otherwise
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source related exception

    • jsonObjectToDataDoc

      public Optional<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> jsonObjectToDataDoc(org.json.JSONObject aJSONObject)
      Converts a JSONObject instance to a data document instance.
      Parameters:
      aJSONObject - JSON object instance
      Returns:
      Optional data document instance

    • loadDoc

      public void loadDoc(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Loads the data document with fields/values of a Redis JSON document. The key name is obtained from Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME. Note: This method does a flat data item assignment. If you need to recover the entire hierarchy, then use the getDoc(String) method.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands

    • getGridData

      public Optional<com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid> getGridData(String aKeyName) throws RedisDSException
      Returns an optional data grid with row data populated from the Redis database based on the key name. Note: Since streams storage could consist of events with different member fields, it is not supported by this call. Also, geo location is best loaded with specialize distance queries and therefore unsupported with this method.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name for data grid
      Returns:
      Optional data item instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • getDataDocKeyNameByRowOffset

      public String getDataDocKeyNameByRowOffset(String aKeyName, int aRowOffset) throws RedisDSException
      Returns the key name of the data document stored in the data grid based on the row offset value.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Data grid key name
      aRowOffset - Row offset
      Returns:
      Key name or an empty string if the row offset is out of range
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • getRowCount

      public long getRowCount(String aKeyName) throws RedisDSException
      Return the count of rows for the data grid identified by the key name in the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name for data grid
      Returns:
      Row count or -1 if key does not exist
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • getRowCount

      public long getRowCount(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid) throws RedisDSException
      Return the count of rows for the data grid identified by the key name in the Redis database. The key name is obtained from the feature Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      Returns:
      Row count or -1 if key does not exist
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • loadGrid

      public void loadGrid(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid, long aRowNumberStart, long aRowNumberFinish) throws RedisDSException
      Loads the data grid rows and columns from the Redis database based on the row start/finish parameters. The key name is obtained from the feature Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME. Note: Any existing rows in the grid will be emptied prior to the load operation.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      aRowNumberStart - Row number start (1 - N)
      aRowNumberFinish - Row number finish (1 - N)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • loadGridPipeline

      public void loadGridPipeline(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid, long aRowNumberStart, long aRowNumberFinish) throws RedisDSException
      Loads the data grid rows and columns from the Redis database based on the row start/finish parameters. The key name is obtained from the feature Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME. As a network optimization, command pipelining is utilized. Note: Any existing rows in the grid will be emptied prior to the load operation.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      aRowNumberStart - Row number start (1 - N)
      aRowNumberFinish - Row number finish (1 - N)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • update

      public void update(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data document stored as a Redis JSON document in the Redis database. Note: This method simply replaces the current Redis JSON in the Redis database (e.g. it does not attempt to selectively identify changed items and limit the update to them via a JSON path).
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands

    • update

      public void update(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc1, com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc2) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data document fields/values in the Redis database as JSON document. The updates are based on a comparison of the two data document instance where updated fields are written to the database. Please note that child data documents are ignored during this operation.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc1 - Data document instance 1 (base)
      aDataDoc2 - Data document instance 2 (changed)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands

    • delete

      public void delete(String aKeyName) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the data document stored as a Redis JSON document from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Redis JSON document key name
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands

    • delete

      public void delete(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the data document stored as a Redis JSON document from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands

    • delete

      public void delete(String aKeyName, long aRowNumber) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the row identified by the row number from the Redis database. The key name is obtained from the feature RedisJson.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME. Note: This method does not delete the data document instance within the data grid instance. You must reload the data grid from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aKeyName - Key name for data grid
      aRowNumber - Row number (1 - N)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • delete

      public void delete(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid, int aRowNumber) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the row identified by the row number from the Redis database. The key name is obtained from the feature RedisJson.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      aRowNumber - Row number (1 - N)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • delete

      public void delete(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid) throws RedisDSException
      Deletes the rows of data documents from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure
      See Also:
      • RedisJSON Commands
